section_title: Application of 52 & 53  Vict.  c. 45. to Scotland.
section_text: 1 Subject to the following provisions, the  Factors Act, 1889, shall apply to Scotland:— 1 The expression “ lien ” shall mean and include right of retention; the expression “ vendor’s lien ” shall mean and include any right of retention competent to the original owner or vendor; and the expression “ set off ” shall mean and include compensation. 2 In the application of section five of the recited Act, a sale, pledge, or other disposition of goods shall not be valid unless made for valuable consideration.
2 This Act may be cited as the Factors (Scotland) Act, 1890.
